info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:31PM EDT until May 21 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR SCOTLAND AND SOUTHEASTERN RICHMOND COUNTIES... At 330 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Chavistown to near Maxton, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Laurinburg, Rockingham, Hamlet, Maxton, Dobbins Heights, Wagram, Gibson, East Laurinburg, Diggs and Laurel Hill. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
